Courses such as database design, python scripting, data science, and cloud systems are related to my industry/research experience as database and software developer. Topics such as enterprise systems and capstone projects are more related to my experience as a data and software architect. Scholarship Selected Recent Publications Reading the Digital Pulse: Context-Aware AI for Sensing Engagement Drivers in Health Forums, 2025 Conference Proceeding Sleepless Generation(s): How the Attention Economy Steals Our Sleep, 2025 Conference Proceeding Reimagining the Sharing Economy through Blockchain: The Case of Helium's Decentralized Wireless Network, 2025 Conference Proceeding The effect of institutional asymmetry on informal entrepreneurship, 2024 Journal Article, Academic Journal The Role of Arts Incubators in Addressing Digital Divide Inequities, 2024 Book, Chapter in Scholarly Book-New Research Interests My research interests can be divided into two main domains. The first domain refers to human behavior in a digital environment, which includes topics such as interaction between information systems humans, and the role of human decision-making processes in online privacy and cybersecurity. The second domain focuses on Applied AI, including topics such as new possibilities of creating new AI models for scientific activities, and refining Generative AI models for improved training and education outcomes.
